intro.title: DISC Work Style Assessment
intro.subtitle: Discover your natural work style and communication preferences

instructions.title: How to Complete This Assessment
steps: Answer each question based on your natural tendencies
Consider how you typically behave, not how you think you should
Focus on your workplace behaviors and communication style
Select the option that best describes your usual approach

columns.title: DISC Framework
columns.content: Understanding behavioral styles to improve workplace communication and effectiveness

points.description: How you interact and share information with others
Your natural approach to tasks and projects
How you evaluate options and make choices
Your role and contributions in team settings

intro.consentText: I understand this assessment will help identify my DISC work style preferences

items.text: How often do team members express frustration about how others communicate?

options.text: Frequently - multiple times per week
Often - at least once per week
Sometimes - a few times per month
Rarely - less than once per month
Never - team members understand and adapt to different communication styles

items.text: How do team members typically respond to disagreements?

options.text: Avoid confrontation or become aggressive
Struggle to find common ground
Try to compromise but often feel unsatisfied
Generally resolve issues through discussion
View disagreements as opportunities for growth

items.text: How well do team members adapt their work approach to different situations?

options.text: Stick rigidly to their preferred style regardless of situation
Find it difficult to adjust their approach
Make some effort to adapt but struggle
Generally adapt well to different situations
Easily adjust their approach based on the situation and people involved

items.text: How do team members approach decision-making?

options.text: Make decisions without considering others' perspectives
Rely heavily on their own style without adapting
Try to consider different approaches but struggle
Generally consider multiple perspectives
Effectively balance different decision-making styles

items.text: How do team members respond to different personality types?

options.text: Frequently clash with those who have different styles
Often misunderstand or misinterpret others' behaviors
Sometimes struggle to work with different styles
Generally work well with different personality types
Effectively leverage different personality strengths

items.text: How do leaders adapt their style to different team members?

options.text: Use a one-size-fits-all approach regardless of individual needs
Struggle to adjust their leadership style
Make some effort to adapt but often miss the mark
Generally adjust their approach based on the situation
Effectively adapt their leadership style to each individual

items.text: How do team members give and receive feedback?

options.text: Feedback often causes tension or is ignored
Struggle to adapt feedback style to the recipient
Try to adjust feedback style but often miss the mark
Generally provide feedback in a way that works for the recipient
Effectively adapt feedback style to each individual's preferences

items.text: How do team members handle change?

options.text: Resist change and struggle to adapt
Find it difficult to adjust to new situations
Make some effort to adapt but often struggle
Generally adapt well to changes
Easily adjust their approach to new situations

items.text: How do team members approach new ideas?

options.text: Stick to familiar approaches and resist new ideas
Often dismiss ideas that don't match their style
Consider new ideas but struggle to implement them
Generally open to different approaches
Effectively balance different approaches to innovation

items.text: How do team members build trust with different personality types?

options.text: Struggle to build trust with those who have different styles
Find it difficult to understand others' trust-building needs
Try to build trust but often miss the mark
Generally build trust effectively across different styles
Easily build trust by adapting to different styles

items.text: How do team members respond to different motivational approaches?

options.text: Only respond to one type of motivation
Struggle to understand what motivates others
Try different approaches but often miss the mark
Generally adapt their motivational approach
Effectively motivate others by understanding their style

items.text: How do team members hold others accountable?

options.text: Use a one-size-fits-all approach to accountability
Struggle to adapt accountability approach
Try different approaches but often ineffective
Generally adapt accountability style
Effectively hold others accountable by adapting to their style

summaries.text: Your DISC profile indicates significant opportunities for improving workplace communication and effectiveness.
Your assessment shows clear areas where DISC-based development would enhance your workplace interactions.
You demonstrate moderate understanding of DISC principles with room for enhanced application.
You show good DISC awareness but could benefit from advanced application techniques.
You demonstrate strong DISC understanding and effective application in workplace situations.

base: Understand the four DISC styles and their key characteristics
Practice active listening techniques to better understand different communication preferences
Develop adaptability in your approach to different work and communication styles
very-high: Complete a comprehensive DISC training program with your team
Identify your primary DISC style and understand how it influences your work approach
Learn specific strategies to communicate effectively with each DISC style
Create team agreements for communication based on different style needs
high: Participate in a focused DISC workshop with your team members
Develop a style-based communication plan for your team
Practice recognizing different behavioral styles in workplace interactions
Set up regular reflection sessions to improve style adaptability
medium: Refresh your understanding of DISC principles through targeted resources
Practice adapting your communication approach with different team members
Identify specific situations where style conflicts occur and develop strategies
Create opportunities to leverage diverse styles on your team
low: Fine-tune your already effective style adaptation techniques
Help others on your team recognize and adapt to different styles
Apply advanced DISC concepts to complex team situations
Document best practices for style-based communication in your team
very-low: Mentor others in recognizing and adapting to different behavioral styles
Explore advanced applications of DISC in challenging workplace scenarios
Develop customized style adaptation strategies for your specific work context

report_structure.title: DISC Work Style Development Report
report_structure.description: A comprehensive analysis of your work style and communication preferences based on DISC principles

critical_focus.title: Priority Focus Areas
critical_focus.description: These areas require immediate attention for improvement

items.description: Focus on developing specific skills and behaviors in this area
actions: Identify key areas requiring immediate attention

development_opportunities.title: Development Opportunities
development_opportunities.description: These areas present opportunities for improvement

items.title: Enhance disc need through targeted interventions
items.description: Implement structured development plans in this area

implementation_strategy.title: Implementation Strategy
implementation_strategy.description: A structured approach to improving your work style effectiveness
recommendations: Identify your dominant DISC style patterns and understand your natural behavioral tendencies
Practice adapting your communication to different styles and learn to flex your approach
Develop strategies for managing stress and conflict
Create action plans for leveraging your strengths
Establish feedback loops for continuous improvement

items.title: Identify your dominant DISC style patterns
Practice adapting your communication to different styles
items.description: Learn to flex your communication approach

items.title: Develop strategies for managing stress and conflict
items.description: Build resilience and conflict resolution skills

items.title: Create action plans for leveraging your strengths
Establish feedback loops for continuous improvement

support_resources.title: Support Resources
support_resources.description: Tools and resources to support your work style development journey
recommendations: DISC Style Guide and Reference Materials - Comprehensive guides for understanding DISC styles
Communication Style Adaptation Tools - Resources for improving communication flexibility
Work Style Assessment Toolkit - Tools for ongoing style assessment and development
Behavioral Pattern Recognition Guide - Guide for identifying and responding to different styles
Style-based Conflict Resolution Resources - Materials for resolving style-based conflicts

Communication Style.high: Focus on developing awareness of different communication styles and practicing adaptability in various workplace situations.
Communication Style.medium: Enhance your understanding of DISC styles and work on flexible communication approaches.
Communication Style.low: Fine-tune your already effective communication style and help others develop their adaptability.

Work Preferences.high: Develop strategies to work effectively with different DISC styles and adapt your approach based on the situation.
Work Preferences.medium: Build on your existing work style while incorporating flexibility for different team dynamics.
Work Preferences.low: Share your effective work strategies while continuing to enhance adaptability.

thankYou.title: Thank You for Completing the DISC Assessment!
thankYou.message: We've captured your natural work style preferences and will provide insights to help you communicate more effectively and work more productively with others.
thankYou.nextSteps: We'll analyze your responses and provide personalized recommendations for leveraging your DISC style. A specialist may contact you to discuss development opportunities.

scorecardInfo.title: Conflict Views
scorecardInfo.shortDescription: Evaluate if your team would benefit from conflict resolution training and mediation techniques
